poem:
**The Quest for Simplicity**

She seeks an egg, plain and pure,  
in a world now dressed with flair,  
a cocoa shell, unadorned,  
nestled in a bed of grass.   
Yet in this maze of confections,  
where even bunnies wear crowns,  
lies the joy of the search—  
the simple delight, when found.
